{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3493829,"name":"Derek W.","username":"deeek","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ce7236/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T17:43:44.821Z","cooked":"

So, recently we had to replace the spindle in our Omio X8 and we got this one because it seemed to match up with the original’s specs, however, we’ve noticed that it is spinning the spindle in the opposite direction now with known, good programs. Nothing else has changed with the machine (ie. wiring, etc.). What is the simplest way to have it reverse it’s direction permanently?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-27T17:43:44.821Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":132,"readers_count":131,"score":46.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":483811,"topic_slug":"omio-x8-new-spindle-rotating-wrong-direction","display_username":"Derek W.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07LG233LM/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&th=1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Huanyang Water Cooled CNC Spindle Milling Motor 110V 2.2KW 24000RPM 400hz Φ80mm ER20 Collet for Engraving Machine - Amazon.com","clicks":20}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13247,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/omio-x8-new-spindle-rotating-wrong-direction/483811/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3493861,"name":"Barkın Var","username":"barkinvar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/barkinvar/{size}/171468_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T18:10:19.022Z","cooked":"

Reversing any two of the three motor phase wires should do the trick as far as I know.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-27T18:10:19.022Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":143.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":483811,"topic_slug":"omio-x8-new-spindle-rotating-wrong-direction","display_username":"Barkın Var","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50115,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9483 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/omio-x8-new-spindle-rotating-wrong-direction/483811/2","custom_user_title":"9483 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3493892,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T18:54:53.573Z","cooked":"

The wiring that changed is internal to the new motor. The connections are largely standardized, but not always.

Pretty much what Barkinar said. With any 3 phase motor, reversing any 2 power wires reverses rotation. Life is a little more difficult if there is an encoder in play, but still reversing the wires to the motor reverses rotation. Probably easiest done at the drive terminals. There should be a parameter in the spindle drive that would do the same thing.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-27T18:54:53.573Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":88,"readers_count":87,"score":77.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483811,"topic_slug":"omio-x8-new-spindle-rotating-wrong-direction","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/omio-x8-new-spindle-rotating-wrong-direction/483811/3","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3493904,"name":"Derek W.","username":"deeek","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ce7236/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T19:08:06.749Z","cooked":"

@barkinvar and @FrankJ, thank you. I had a feeling that I would need to pop open the controller.

It depends on what is easier to do.

If there are screw terminals on the motor side, make the change there. Otherwise, it is likely that thereare screw terminals on the output of the VFD making the 3-phase for driving the motor.

Popping the controller open revealed that swapping two of the U/V/W cables was the easiest route to go. On the motor side it is a 4-pin connector which wouldn’t be feasible. After swapping it out it is working like a charm! Thank you everyone!

IMG_39691920×1772 351 KB
